Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I was disappointed with on my tour through Spain.”
Reviews.Author: snoopy1128
Reviews.Content: This was the ninth hotel we stayed in on our tour through Spain while we were on the Globus tour Spanish Fiesta. We started the tour 2 weeks prior in Madrid but stayed at a different hotel- The Atocha. The Atocha was a superior hotel. The Agumar is only a 2 star hotel. My husband and myself were worried about this hotel since he wrote the hotel 5 times before he received a response. He wrote 4 times in March and he tried again in June. He was writing to ask the hotel the best way to get to the airport and to request a non- smoking quiet room with a queen sized bed if possible since this was an anniversary trip for us. In June they finally responded about the transportation, but made no mention of his other requests. We arrived at the hotel about 7PM on Sat. Aug. 4. We had to hurry to get dressed since our farewell dinner was at the hotel at 7:30 PM. When I opened our door to our room I immediately smelled a strong odor- something had been sprayed into the room to cover up the odor in the room. I wondered what odor they were trying to hide when I noticed an ash tray in the room. This was a smoking room! I got dressed for dinner and when I opened the door into the hallway I could smell cigarette smoke in the hallway. They had put the entire Globus group on a smoking floor!I couldn't believe it! We opened the terrace door and put on the a/c to try to get the smell out of our room. I would have asked for a different room, but we had no time to change rooms. We had the farewell dinner and by the time we got back to our room it was 9:30. We had to get up at 5:30 to get to the airport. 7:30 was our farewell dinner. Another Globus group I think it was the Iberian vacation was having their welcome dinner at the same time. It was a dinner buffet. The food was awful. It was fish which had bones in it, garlic chicken, pasta with fish sauce on it (I am allergic to fish). There were also cold meats, cheeses and breads. We also had a pitcher of sangria for 6 people. I kept comparing this hotel to the Atocha which we had at the beginning of this tour- There was absolutely no comparison. Re: the room- My husband had requested a queen or at least 2 double beds since it was our anniversary trip. Instead we had 2 tiny single beds with a telephone in between so you could not put the beds together.The beds were very plain looking without bed spreads. Wifi was 6 euro for 1 hour. We paid the fee so we could print our boarding passes. We asked the person at the desk to print our passes for us, but he was not helpful. We did find one helpful person- there was 1 nice gentleman who helped us to use the computer and printer. Pros at this hotel- 1) Location - walking distance to Atocha station and the metrobus to get to the airport. 2) Take away breakfast was Ok. They packed us a bag breakfast to take to the airport which consisted of juice, water,cake, and a ham and cheese sandwich which was OK 3) nice sized soap in an individual box. Cons at this hotel 1) They put everyone on our tour on a smoking floor without asking 2) Dinner buffet- poor 3) Rooms had only 2 single beds Would I recommend this hotel?- I am sorry to say no. I have rated many hotels on Trip Advisor and this is the first hotel I have given a poor rating to and would not recommend- especially since my husband wrote 5 e-mails to the hotel asking for directions and specifically requesting a non smoking room with a queen or at least a double bed for the end of our anniversary trip. I am sorry that Globus did not use the same hotel as our welcome dinner the Atocha. Many others on our tour felt the same way as we did. If you are on a Globus tour and this is one of your hotels I would 1) Insist on a non smoking room before you take the key unless you are a smoker. 2) Ask about the type of bed they are going to give you.

Reviews.Title: “Close to museums but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Family_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a tour group. Since there were more than one group, it was crowded with a waiting line during breakfast. Agumar is within walking distance to the big 3 museums (Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofia) in Madrid, so as to Paque del Retiro. However, it is not centrally located. It is close to Atocha Station (5 min) and Old Madrid is a short taxi ride (< 7 EUR) away. There is a disco right at the premise. Music played late and kept many people up at night. So if you are staying here, ask for the higher floor. There is a grocery store right across the street. Internet costs 3 EUR/if you use their PC (with a printer) on the lobby. Else, it is 6 EUR/day. Rooms and bathroom are good size, A/C works. Personally, I will rather stay closer to Old Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late in the evening and we have chosen this hotel especially for its location. Actually, we were going the following day to Salamanca with a bus from Estacion Sur which is about 1,5 km. from the hotel. Not really near but also feasible on foot with a small trolley. The area near the hotel doesn't offer anything, apart a small shop where you can buy water, biscuits, etc. without spending a lot more buying these things at the hotel. The check in and the check out have been very efficient and without problems and the staff was very friendly. Both the hall and the room were very elegant and there were a lot of services available. We haven't used these services because of our limited time at the hotel. Probably the location is not the best for visiting Madrid but there is a metro station not far away. Finally, a big advantage is the price really competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Got cheated by Hotel Agumar and Hotels.com”
Reviews.Author: v9n
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with hotels.com and Hotel Agumar after my stay on 7/31/2012. The rooms and location were fine but there was an accidental double booking that I was not aware of (one went to an incorrect email) and on looking at my credit card transactions after the stay - it turns out that they double-charged me. The staff should have been aware that there was a double booking and should have told me on check in. Feels like the hotel management is not honest and both hotels.com and the Agumar hotel management are refusing to refund the additional charges ($146). I feel convinced I have been cheated and hence the bad rating. Will also try other means to get my refund and report this to BBB. Will appreciate if anyone with ideas how I can pursue this.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Museums and Atocha Station”
Reviews.Author: Chichi50
Reviews.Content: Big, clean rooms, close to Atocha Station, Prado and Reina Sofia Museum. Air conditioner works very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: enroute55
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for the major museums, just a 15min stroll away. Attractive, spacious and clean room with a splendid view (see photo) facing the street from an upper floor. Just £60/night through ebookers (via Tripadvisor), offered excellent value for money. Was upgraded after reception accidentally gave me a room with someone already in it. A surprise for both of us, but was very pleased with how quickly they made amends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jennya0701
Reviews.Content: The only thing that disappointed was that it's not centrally located. I liked that it was close to the train station and was a short 10 minutes walk with luggage in tow. But it's a good distance to main attractions which was a pain. I also was annoyed that they charged 6€ for wi-fi, I mean come on, this day and age wi-fi should be free and just part of the service provided. If B&B's run by independent operators can provide wi-fi free then I'm sure hotels can absorb the cost ad well.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: jujSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the Agumar - a 4-night stay, and then one night before our flight home. The first 4 nights we had a very clean room (620) with parquet floors and two twin beds that had been pushed together to make a "double". The beds tended to move around a bit, as they slid easily on the parquet. But the parquet was nice and clean, bath was clean and somewhat updated, and the A/C worked great! The hotel was ~5 min walk to the Atocha Renfe metro stop and ~10 min to the train station. The Aeropuerto Express bus to/from the airport stops at the train station and only cost 5 euro. Based on the cleanliness and convenience of the hotel, we booked the Agumar again for our last night, but the room we got on our last night (305) was on a different floor and different side of the hotel. It smelled noticeably smoky in the hallway - though not as strong in the room and it got better once we turned on the A/C. The room had cheap carpet, so didn't seem as clean and bright as our first room. I had requested a double, but the twin beds this time were separated by a nightstand. Fortunately we were only there one night. The breakfast buffet was quite excellent - nice spread of hams, chorizo, and cheeses; hot items including fried eggs, bacon, potatoes, tortillas; breads, pastries, fruit, yogurts and cereals; juices, water, and coffee. Wi-fi also worked pretty well although it's 6 euro/24 hr period and can only be used on one device at a time. Overall, a decent, efficient, no frills stay. I might look elsewhere if I were to return to Madrid but overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Value oreinted close to Madrid's main Museums!”
Reviews.Author: TonyTonyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you are value oriented. It's a bit of a walk to the Madrid's main museums, but totally walkable. Safe and very clean. We stayed in Madrid on route to Morocco - so we were only there for a day. We wanted an expensive hotel - well located. Arumar fit the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: DCH47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agumar with a tour group and found it to be comfortable enough. The hotel is older but clean and well maintained. Our room was very small but comfortable and we were pleased with how well the air conditioning worked. The hotel is a short walk from the train station and within 20-25 minutes walking distance to the Prado. The food at the hotel is overpriced so we didn't eat anything but the included breakfast, which was fine. There are a few small eateries nearby and food is available at the train station, but for a nice meal you'll need to take a cab or public transportation. We were put off by the 6 euro per hour fee for using the internet or wifi and the 15 euro cash deposit required for a key to the in-room safe. We would have liked to have been able to put the safe deposit on our room charge or credit card instead of using cash, as this was the last day of our tour and our local currency was running short. One of the desk clerks was a bit brusque but the other we dealt with was very friendly and helpful. Overall a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star quality”
Reviews.Author: Hikermeister
Reviews.Content: As I have said in other reviews, a Spanish 4 star rating pretty much means 3 star quality compared with North America. The Agumar in Madrid is OK, that's all. The room had a double bed, one soft chair and a desk and chair. The bathroom was spacious. Good points: --they provided wash cloth, tissues and robe. Weak points-- --cheap laminate floor --small room on an air shaft, on the 8th floor, with no lift (stairs from the 7th floor) --no drawers ----only light switches were in the far corner of the room --the TV channels were totally different than the listings --no free internet or safe

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenH122
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night but found the staff very helpful and friendly the rooms were a good size and had everything we needed. It is in a nice location as it is a quiet area but very close to transport links, bars and resturants and all of the museums. The park is amazing and our favourite spot in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in the complex near to the metro station and the park which is a very good place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: pepe6491
Reviews.Content: This was a well located hotel. It was clean and comfortable. Bus to center was right outside and the metro was a few blocks away. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay. The only negative was you had to pay to use the safe deposit box in the room. Also, wifi was extra but that was not a big deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the city break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Arczik
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in this hotel. Service was great, always helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Location: close to Atocha train station, metro, museums. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “it was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: NadezhdaSofia
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in "Agumar" and both I and my friend were quite content with the quality of the room, the food and the service. It was clean and comfortable, the beds were soft and welcoming after a day's walking and in the morning a rich and tasty breakfast gave us all the energy to explore Madrid and Toledo ( which is less than an hour away if you stay in this hotel ). Pros: nice area, close to a metro station and the railway station, good standard of service and qualified personnel. We did not find any significant shortcomings and this is quite a compliment for the staff because we are professional travellers - stewardesses.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: La_Petite_Irlandaise
Reviews.Content: Pros : *Close to metro & museums *price ok *room & bathroom clean *very good breakfast (it was included in our rate) Cons *Bed unstable - it moved everytime one of us turned ! *Noisy *No way to control the temperature in the room, apart from opening the window onto a noisy street. *room deco non-existent

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: tonyjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business this week. There are pros and cons about this place. The cons are, in no particular order - its dated especially the lobby area. I had a meal in the coffee shop and it was ridiculously small. Pork steak was four mouthfuls of sliced pork and eight chips. yes - 8. I counted them, for 13 euro. The lifts take forever, the walls are paper thin and you can hear any corridor conversation, and the beds slide away from the wall when you even touch them! The pros however are these; Its reasonably priced, a short walk to Atocha station and Metro system, the breakfast is fine, and the staff are friendly. the wifi is very fast and cheap at €6 per day. The rooms themselves are fine also, and not as dated as the rest of the hotel. I would recommend for a couple of days in Madrid, but lay off the Solomillo Iberico (pork steak) unless you are feeding a three year old.

Reviews.Title: “Good....!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reddy19
Reviews.Content: Good hotel , friendly staff and easy access to atocha sta.....!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4* hotel near downtown Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MarcoTsanginHK
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in this business class hotel when I come to Madrid for meeting. Rate is quite reasonable but it is sometimes too quickly to be fully booked. Staff are nice and room us clean. WiFi charges is reasonable at Euro 6.00 per day, and the reception is excellent. However, it is located in the other direction of Atocha train station (main in Madrid ) which might turn some visitors away, but it takes only 5 mins to the terminal. It should not overshadow all its strength.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: acumsang
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and hotel clean and well located. The downside was the breakfasts which were poor. Plenty staff but if you were later than 8:30 am the hot food was mostly gone but when we say 'hot' it never was. Also if you left your table to get something else from the brkfst buffet they had cleared your table away. Someone had to sit while the other went to choose their food. An urn with hot water wd hve been useful too as there was never any for tea unless you asked and they eventually brought a very small pot.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous and spoke Engish! The room was comfortable and spacious and clean. Very good for a reasonable price! This hotel is perfectly located near the main train station and El Prado museum The breakfast buffet is excellent and the staff are very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel - very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Alexsas777
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to write about this.... the only thing probably worth to mention is value for money, it was 70 euros per night, not too bad for the hotel in the centre. Though the hotel itself looks a bit dated, rooms were ok, clean and spacious, and breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned, but very decent and acceptable”
Reviews.Author: puchurrin
Reviews.Content: As I say in many of my reviews, don't expect this to be a fancy hotel. Indeed is a quite average one, looking very 80s or early 90s. In American standards I would say it is a 3 star hotel. I only stayed here a couple of nights before flying back home, and it was in Easter time, so everything around looked boring and most places were closed... but that has to do with the period. Pros: Clean, good location close to many attractions, good rooms. Cons: I think value for money could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location...apart from noisey street outside”
Reviews.Author: ruth_ian2011
Reviews.Content: We visited madrid for 3 nights in January and stayed at the Agumar. The hotel is easily reached from the airport, just take the airport bus for 2 euros and get off at the last stop and the hotel is a few minutes walk from the bus station. Its also in short walking distance of the atocha renfe metro station which will get you anywhere you want to go. We had a 48 hour metro pass but walked to the main sites on the other 2 days so its easily done. The hotel itself is clean and the staff are welcoming and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and have some nice freebies (shampoo etc) The only problem we had was the room was very very warm which made it uncomfortable to sleep, although we set the air con at 16 degrees (the lowest setting) and told reception of the problem, nothing seemed to help. We did open the windows which made sleeping impossible due to the noisy street and night club below. All in all - a good base for an amazing trip.

Reviews.Title: “A little old and faded, but comfy”
Reviews.Author: feleesy
Reviews.Content: We were planning to base ourselves in Madrid, and make day trips to Toledo and Segovia by train, so getting a hotel right next to the main Puerta Atocha station seemed like a good bet. We found a 40% deal on Agumar Hotel on hotels.com so we went for it. The hotel itself looked a little old and faded (but not so much that we didn't want to stay in it), and had a feeling of past splendour about it. The room itself was very clean and well kept, and we had very good sleep in it. We found the counter staff professional, helpful and courteous, but reservedly so (in a slightly business-hotelish kind of way). Now on to location. It is a 10 to 15 minute walk from Puerta Atocha station as well as the nearest Metro station. That is very near when you are not carrying any luggage (as was the case when we were heading off to Toledo and Segovia for day trips), but is far enough to be uncomfortable when you are lugging your full load (i.e. checking in or checking out and going to or from Puerta Atocha station). The area around the hotel is very suburb-ish and there isn't much to do in the way of eating or shopping around the hotel (though the excellent Prado museum, Reina Sofia museum and Thyssen museum are all within walking distance). Overall, I thought that with the 40% discount, it was the most value for money that we got in terms of accommodation in our whole trip. That said, if there was no discount and we had to pay full price, I might have looked elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, you get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: bes55
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, not that close to the center, but not that far either, which for me justified the price. It was not too expensive, and we got it very last minute. Amenities are limited, but it was not bad. The location should not be too much of a turn-off as the metro (subway) system is good, and it was not that difficult to get to the different stations, and everywhere around the town. Two stations near the hotel on line 1 are Atocha Renfe and Menendez Pelayo. If you decide to take the train to the hotel from the Airport and you get to Atocha - you really don't need to take a taxi - it is a 5-7 minute walk. The room was not too big, but it was enough for us, and we were not spending that much time at the hotel. Two of the beds were not bad for sleeping (twin size), the third one was an "arm-chair"-bed, which was not very good for the back. The bathroom is large, and has most things needed, but there was almost no pressure for the water (on the 5th floor) - so showers took a while. We were there in December, so the heating was on (good), and made the air a bit "dry", so we opened the windows to let a bit of fresh air in, which could make it a bit noisy from the traffic on the street. When we were checking in the staff was not too friendly, in fact they seemed a bit preoccupied with other things (not sure what) but definitely not our arrival, and they did not speak English. The only information provided upon our request for a map was a brochure of attractions around town. On our check-out however they were very helpful, and friendly, and the reception was full of different brochures, and maps... so I guess it depends on who's at the desk. There are different buttons to call the 3 available elevators, I don't know how this made sense... which was slightly confusing in the beginning, but overall - not a big deal. The TV offered about 10-12 Spanish channels, in addition to English and French speaking news channels: BBC, CNN, CNBC, France 24. There is a cafeteria - but we never eat there, so can't speak for the quality of the food. Overall an average place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but needs a bit of modernising”
Reviews.Author: T_Mac911
Reviews.Content: I can see why this hotel has a 4 star rating as when it was built it was probably more deserving of it than it is now. I would say that the hotel needs a bit of modernising especially in the floor corridor areas and somewhat in the room as the décor was a bit bland and the curtains were a little old world. However saying all of that the room was clean (which counts for a lot for me) and tidy. A lot of people have commented on the lack of free Wi-Fi and I think that is something they could introduce. The only other gripe I had was there was little English speaking TV and it would have been nice in the absence of this to have the option to get English Subtitles. Overall it was a good trip. Depending on how long you are going for, we purchased the 13 euro 3 day travel pass which was great as it took us from the Airport to Atocha. It is important to note that you can get the airport bus to terminal 4 to take the Renfe (Overground Train) or to terminal 2 to get the metro. I would suggest doing the earlier (especially if you have bags) as the walk from terminal 1 to 2 feels like an age and there 2 changes on the metro to get to Atocha whereas the Renfe will take you there directly (at a slower pace) but in comfort and with less hassle and when you get out of the station the hotel at a stretch is only around 3 minutes away. Some people commented about the hotel not being in a central location but it is only 4 stops from Sol (which is one of if not the main area for activity) and we actually walked it there in 20 minutes once we knew the direction we were going in. If you like sights I would suggest doing the madrid tour and going to the Bernabeu stadium which even my wife thought was great and she is not a football fan. On the whole hotel location was fine and had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “All I needed”
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist
Reviews.Content: `The Agumar was what I expected. The Good: Clean, quiet room (#803), comfy bed, very helpful staff. This is not an expensive hotel so amenities are limited but satisfactory. Wifi was only 6 euros per day. I booked through Orbitz and total cost for 2 days was $188 for a single room with a full size bed. The bathroom included a tub, a good size vanity, and a bidet. The main reason I booked was price and walking proximity to Atocha train station and Prado Museum. The Bad: I didn't received any eye-contact or verbal acknowledgement when I first came to the reception desk. I wasn't sure which pre-occupied staff person was the person who would check me in. I waited, in my opinion, too long for one of them to help me. Maybe they were shy of their less than perfect English which should not be the case in a reception job. The bed was on wheels and moved away from the wall at the head when I got into it. If my review has been helpful, please click on "yes". Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel???”
Reviews.Author: BritVisitor_11
Reviews.Content: Not sure when this place received four stars, but it certainly doesn't deserve them now. The staff were quite unfriendly on our arrival. When we got to our room (309), it was distinctly tired-looking. The top of the walls were quite dirty where the heating system had blown out warm air. The bath/shower glass screen was dirty and there were signs of mildew in the bathroom. There was a safe in the wardrobe, but no key. We had to pay 2 euros a day to keep our belongings safe and save the hotel a lot of hassle. In addition, there was a 15 euro deposit to pay for the key. The hotel's location is handy for Atocha station, but it is three or four metro stops from the centre of Madrid. Hardly city centre. I would think carefully before you book this hotel. We won't be returning there next time we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms and service, good location”
Reviews.Author: frugaltravelerDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night during a recent trip to Spain. We were very early so the staff couldn't find us a room, but they took our baggage in while we went for a walk around town. The hotel is very close to Reina Sofia, Prado, Retiro Park etc - 10 minute walk. It is also a 10 minute walk from Atocha train station (where the Airport Express Bus dropped us off). The area seemed very safe - we saw lots of people walking (especially women walking alone) even at night. You can walk to Puerta del Sol (~20 minutes) but we took the metro. The room was very clean and quite spacious. The hotel itself is rather old and could do with an update, but they have done their best to keep it very clean and useable. Only nit pick is that internet is not free, even in the lobby. A good mid-range option near Atocha with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bookeworm
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Madrid after a flight where I had been up almost 24 hours. The staff checked me in at 10am with no charge, almost 4 hours earlier than normal. It was so nice to get a nap and shower! Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: neil4ever22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel only for a night. But the overall location of the hotel was great. It was just a couple of minutes away from Atocha station, where you could get a direct Airport bus at 2 euros. Breakfast was nice and sufficient, serving a variety of dishes. The porter took the bags to the room on check-in which was not done at the other hotels we stayed at in Spain. There were a few cafes around the place, which made it a convenient place. You could easily connect to the other places in Madrid, as there was a bus stop outside the hotel and also conveniently located to the metro.. TV had a few English channels, which was nice for a change. The hotel had an Internet station at the reception area, which could be accessed at no charge. Mini bar was nice and big. Bathroom was clean and had a bathtub. Happy with the stay at Agumar

Reviews.Title: “You cheated If you buy the hotel as CITY center”
Reviews.Author: chipman75
Reviews.Content: we came to mAdrid with a tour from istanbul,turkey on november the 4th and still staying at agumar hotel. The tour sell this hotel to us as city center hotel but when we try to go to the center from the hotel we recognise that we were cheated. The hotel is located far away from the center. When you step out of the hotel turn right and by 10 min walk you can reach to atocha renfe metro station and by 5 min walk in station you reach the train. After 4 stop you finally reach SOL !!! By taxi it costs 6~7 € from the hotel to SOL. The reception is not friendly and helpful. No free wifi. the open buffet and the cleanness of the rooms are the only positive sides of this hotel. İn addition when you walk 100meter left from the hotel , you can see a big supermarket on your right side called Hiber and you can find everything you need maybe more.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you just want a decent room in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: holidaysforus
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Got the shuttle bus from the airport to Atocha station for 2 euros each - about a 25 minute journey. If you keep your back to the station and look to the right you will see a Repsol garage. You need to cross the main road and the hotel is on the road the other side of that garage - about a five to 10 minute walk past the garage. I had e-mailed ahead and asked for a non smoking room and directions to get to the hotel and I got a very quick response. The room was a good size and clean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we thought 15 euros a head was expensive. There are a number of cafe/bars within 10 minutes walk to choose from and we had coffee croissants and orange juice for about 4 euros each. There were coach parties there each day of our stay but they didn't cause us any problems. It was quite a walk to the main places of interest but Metro and buses were both nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, unfriendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Emzzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agumar Hotel for 3 nights, and found it was in an ideal location for Atocha Station. We got the shuttle bus from the Airport for 2euros each, which dropped you right outside the station. From Atocha the hotel is 5-10 min walk. The hotel room itself was ok but nothing special, the bed was large but very hard and uncomfortable. Although our room wasn't a smoking room, outside in the corrider it absolutley reeked of smoke. We did have the breakfast buffet which was a bit pricey for 15euros each, but found there to be plenty of choice. The hotel was in a residential area, and is a bit of a walk to all the attractions Madrid has to offer. The staff at the hotel were really unfriendly and could hardly raise a smile, this was from the reception staff to the waiters. I've never stayed in such an unfriendly place and for that reason would not return or recommend the Agumar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: Price and location were the main factors in our decision to book this hotel for a weekend away with a group of friends. And we weren't disappointed. Since some of the group were arriving by train, the proximity to nearby Atocha station worked out very well. Buses run frequently from outside the hotel, and its a short walk (unfortunately) to the nearest Metro station. I say unfortunately since the Madrid Metro is absolutely crawling with pickpockets. No less than three of our group - myself (a seasoned traveller) included - were done by pickpockets on the Metro over the course of the weekend. The hotel is fine, if not spectacular. Rooms and bathrooms are good quality, with standard satellite TV, minibar, and usual extras. Breakfasst is extra, though we never actually availed of it - since Madrid has so much to offer by way of cafes, bars and other eateries. The hotel - though close enough to the city centre - has a local neighbourhood feel to it. and seemed to attract lots of locals to its Salsa Dancing nigthclub, which seemed very popular (didn';t go there ourselves) A couple of minor quibbles: - Two of the three levators were out of order for the weekend, whioch became a bit of a nuisance after a while: - We requested a smoking room, since my wife is a lifelong tobacco addict. However, the room smelt like an ashtray. The smell of stale tobacco seemed to be embedded into every fabric of the room, and was quite overpowering - even though I have co-habitated with a smoker for most of my life. In summary, avoid the smoking room and the metro. Better still, lock up all the pickpockets in the smoking room indefinitely.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Lvngstrng
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near the main train station. The train station has the metro and the high-speed train to nearby cities. You can take one train to and from the airport to this train station (Atocha-Renfe). The walk at night to the hotel from the train station can be scary due to poor street lighting, but it is not a reflection of the neighborhood. The hotel is also very close to the botanical gardens, el Parque del Retiro, and El Museo del Prado. The hotel staff were friendly and the hotel is very clean. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chepaddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age but was clean and is well located. It was only a few minutes walk past the Atocha train station to the Prado museum. Staff were not overly friendly but we have stayed in this hotel on more than one occasion when we were in Madrid and would stay here again primarily for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Good price/quality rate. Next to Madrid's most important museums”
Reviews.Author: rbecerra
Reviews.Content: I usually select this hotel because is near to railways and tube station. They offer very good prices if you reserve directly from their web page. Restaurant is a bit expensive but you have a lot of restaurant in that zone of Madrid with a lot of diferent solutions for your breakfast, lunch or dinner...

Reviews.Title: “pricey but good”
Reviews.Author: scona81
Reviews.Content: good but small rooms. everything paid for at hotel I expensive, drinks, wifi, breakfast, etc, is in a great location though and very nice to stay, would recommend eating and drinking elsewhere though

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, though pretty noisy”
Reviews.Author: luigi66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for more than a week, in August. As we were four people, we booked a family room, with two communicating rooms and one bathroom. The rooms were nice, but had one major drawback: they overlooked Paseo della Reina Cristina, which is a very loud large road leading to Atocha Railway Station. Unfortunately, this road is pretty busy also at night. Therefore, if you are not used to earplugs, you will have problems, as I did. The rooms were pretty spacious and bedding comfortable, but did not provide any complementary facility (coffee, tea making facilities, or free wi-fi). As for the rest, location is perfect in terms of proximity to major cultural attractions, and reception quite helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hlaci
Reviews.Content: Hotel is OK, nothing special. Very good location, 5 min. walk to underground and Retiro Park. Rooms are quiet big, bathroom clean.

Reviews.Title: “Without reservation I recommend this excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan P
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a city break in Madrid and in addition to being charmed by the city we were charmed by this hotel. Travelling to the hotel from the airport couldn't be easier there is a yellow bus that takes you from the airport straight to Atocha metro station at the cost of 2 Euros. We were going to get in a taxi from the metro station to the hotel but the taxi driver explained that it was at best a 10 min walk to the hotel and that all we needed to do was turn right out of metro station and then take the left road as the road forks in to two. As you approach the Agumar it doesn't look like a 4 star hotel but as soon as you step in side it lives up to its claims. The lobby area / reception looks extremely classy and the bedrooms are clean, large and spacious with big comfortable beds and come with elegant looking bathrooms and the essential air con which is needed in such a hot country. Also the beds were made and towels replaced when needed after daily visits by chamber maids. We were greeted by friendly hotel staff who throughout our stay answered any queries we had patiently and attentively. For example they explained that the 32 bus that stops outside hotel takes you into main area 'Plaza Mayor' and recommended shops to us etc. In terms of the food at the hotel I cannot comment as we didn't eat there because we were on a budget. There are places close by at very reasonable prices that you can eat and drink at but I recommend heading on 32 bus to Plaza Mayor for more variety and culture. Upon checking out of the room on the last day for 12 o clock they were happy to look after our bags in reception while we did some last minute shopping before our flight later in the afternoon. Without reservation I recommend this excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Nna16
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Very clean! Nice bathrooms and room size and bed was comfortable. Location good but not great. Nice staff that were very helpful. Buffet not that great, dont add that to your room and restaurant not that great, but otherwise very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: vermodilien
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, because the bed is large and comfortable. The bathroom is clean. We also tried the breakfast, where we found a variety of foods. The location is also ok, you can find a metro nearby.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel near to train station”
Reviews.Author: suthas
Reviews.Content: agumar hotel is about a 10 min walk to the train station, shopping and eating area. buffet is plentiful and quite a good variety. rooms are comfortable and the staff members were very helpful. a 3 and half star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachelEFMY
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Madrid early on the Trainhotel so I arrived mid morning at the hotel. Despite this, I was still able to get access to my room, which greatly improved my day. The room was spacious and clean. The hotel is convenient for the Atosha train station and also for the big museums. I will probably seek this hotel out again, as it provides excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rose2364
Reviews.Content: Fiarly clean (room has carpet). Quiet. Near two metro stops so easy to get to from the airport (but watch out for pickpockets!). However, location wasn't great - about a 20 minute walk to Prado and dining. Buffet breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a little off the main sights”
Reviews.Author: JohnLackland
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, clean and proper with quite comfortable rooms and a very good breakfast. The staff is professional and polite, but smiles are scarce. The hotel is located in a mainly recidental area with few bars and restaurants and slightly off the main sights of Madrid, but if you are not afraid of a little walk, this hotel is a very good choice, and it deserves its four stars. The most serious downside is the lack of free internet. especially if you bring teenage children.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Bad,reception staff helpful and thin wall!”
Reviews.Author: 0_Gyrfalcon_0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for night of 16 and 22 - 25 totally 5 night.The breakfast were all same everyday.Never stay in any the *4 hotels had same breakfast everyday before.Oh well this is the first one.The hot meal all COLD as the same everyday likes scrumble egg,tortilla and sausage.The cold cut meat section taste like a very cheap package meat that sell in supermarket.But they have a good and fresh watermelon and pineapple,fresh fruits juice.The bakery section were so so and cold.I had try the red wine..oh god taste like a 25 cent cooking wine (Coz of wine price there all quite cheap 4 - 6 euros in supermarket all acceptable).My cooking wine at home I paid for 14 SGD taste a lotttt better than that wine. So,my recommended if you stay in this hotel just get a room.(bf price 15++ euro per person) For the price,the night of 16 we paid for 167 usd the rest of it paid for 108 euros a night included breakfast. The location is OK.You can walk from Atocha Renfe for 7 - 8 mins to this hotel.When I picked this hotel I though it closer than this for the price we paid for the first night.If you are looking for the hotel near by AVE train I recommend NH 4* hotel opposite the station.It 's very close and look nice too. The quality of the room is O.K The wall is thin you can hear any single words from the room next door.The bed is firm for the first night the less of it were soft..I had trouble to sleep on night 22 - 25.But lazy to ask them to change the room. The receptions all speak good english and also very helpful when I walk over to ask for direction for the famous churros shop and restaurant.They explain really clear and print a google map for me :) The wifi internet had a decent speed paid for 6 euros a day..work from noon to noon not count by 24 hrs like the hotel in Asia. Lobby big and 3 elevators I would recommend this hotel to my friend if the price rank about 75 - 85 euros not the price I was paid.

Reviews.Title: “Two times lucky”
Reviews.Author: ATWTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and her fiance had recommended this hotel to us because it was close to the train station. It is not luxurious, but the king sized bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was immaculate, and the extensive breakfast buffet offered a good variety of food choices. We were within walking distance of the Retiro park and close to a metro stop. On our next visit, I would actually choose this hotel over two of the five-star hotels I know in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “SO-SO in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CHIEFGNewJersey_Usa
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, affordable & convenient to Atocha Train Station & Airport Express Bus. Breakfast Buffet was ample, evening restaurant limited & expensive. Curiously, the waiters are not the friendliest. Front desk & doormen were most helpful. No free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, quiet and roomy”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid for the final soccer match between Spain and Holland, and I was staying at this hotel during those days because I got an amazing rate and stayed for a week. The hotel itself is very good... clean, rooms are very big and comfortable, beds are big, My perks: -I got a room with a view to the inside patio, meaning it was dark when it was actually very sunny outside. However it was not such a problem as I did not spend too much time in the room. I asked for a change but the hotel was booked solid. -Internet was not free, it cost around 7 euros per day and they would give you a code to use it. But it was very fast. -The signal of the cable channels was really BAD!!! -The location: If you are in Madrid for tourism, it can present quite a problem if you like to do things by foot, since the hotel is in Atocha and even though it's close to the center, it is not THAT close. The closest subway station is Menendez Pelayo, about three blocks down. I liked this hotel, but I prefer something closer to the center. The good: -Cleaning staff was very efficient. They clean the rooms up to 4 pm, not later than that. -The room was so big I could not believe it. -It is relatively a quiet area of Madrid, so you won't have problems with noise. There is a night club at the hotel, but you could hardly hear it. -Location: Although it is not in the main happening area of Madrid (there are some popular nightclubs at ronda de Atocha, though) it is a safe and beautiful neighborhood where you find supermarkets and restaurants. I would stay at this hotel again definitely, as long as I get a high floor with a window facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid For New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: countercomedian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Agumar for 2 nights with breakfast. The room was comfortable and clean, but very poor view, they seriously need soundproofing as you can hear everything for the room next door (suggest earplugs - we used them) Bathroom a little tired and due a revamp. Staff were very helpful and the breakfast was excellent buffet style. Short 5 min walk to Metro station or taxi to centre approx 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convenient choice”
Reviews.Author: Rgroll
Reviews.Content: Selected for its convenience to the three art museums in the Golden Triangle. Very convenient, clean, quiet and pleasant hotel. An easy 10 to 15 minute walk to the Prado etc. Five minutes to Atocha station. Relatively easy trip from the airport by subway --- one transfer and 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location, but overpriced, noisy, poor bathroom and air conditioning was turned off!”
Reviews.Author: TaZmAnUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel location is ok - walking distance to a metro station and the nearby Retiro park. When we arrived, the staff didn't even offer to take our bags or suitcase up to our room - despite there being plenty of staff doing nothing. There were no coffee / tea making facilities in the rooms (no kettle, mugs etc) which was shocking for an apparently 4 star hotel. The rooms were too hot and stuffy in the evenings as the air conditioning had been purposely switched off centrally by the staff - we complained about this but were told it was tough. We ended up having to keep our balcony doors open to ventilate the room. We were actually lied to by the staff and told originally that the Air Conditioning was faulty and that a repair man would be repairing it after we left - however, we later found out from other staff that the hotel had actually switched off the Air Conditioning on purpose throughout the entire hotel and that they would not be switching it back on on until May the following year (7 months later!) - this was just to save money... We were extremely angry about this and shocked as you would expect. All the rooms were advertised as having Air Conditioning when we made our booking and we would never have booked had we known there would be no Air Conditioning. The people in other rooms in our corridor were also unhappy with the air conditioning situation. The room itself wasn't too bad - although it was pretty small for 2 people. There weren't many english channels on the TV, the BBC World news channel was all we could really watch which was disappointing. The safe in the rooms was not included in the price. The balcony was absoutely tiny (could barely fit 2 people standing on it), however, it was nice to be able to stand there in the evenings and overlook the busy street. Street noise is loud all day and night infront of the hotel - we had bin men shouting at 3AM and collecting bins and police always going past the hotel with their sirens on throughout most nights. Be warned that the windows do not keep all the street noise out and the street infront of this hotel never sleeps. The room walls are paper thin - we could hear the person next door constantly talking on the phone and her TV could be heard loudly in our room throughout the night - this was very disappointing. The bedding, towels and soaps were changed regularly, however, both myself and my wife had loads of bites and itching from the bed - we were both convinced that there were bed bugs or mites in the bed... The bed was comfortable, however, it kept moving across the room everytime anyone moved slightly. The bathroom was extremely old and outdated and in dire need of an urgent refit - probably one of the worst shower / baths I've seen in any hotel. The hotel is very overpriced and didn't even include breakfast for the price. The staff weren't very helpful or friendly apart from one of the doormen who was excellent and helped us alot. There were no computers to access the internet, so if you don't bring your own laptop, you won't be able to access internet from this hotel. Again this was disappointing for a 4 star hotel. Personally, I would class this hotel as a 2 star hotel at most - I have stayed in many 3 star hotels with more facilities than this hotel and nicer rooms and bathrooms. It is definitely NOT a 4 star hotel. The location was reasonably good, however, we wouldn't return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth5652
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one used by the 12 day Group Tour of Spain which we were a part of. Therefore, I have no idea how much the Tour Operator paid for each night. So when I decided I wanted to stay in Madrid another night, I called the T O to ask how much an extra night through her would be, I was told it would be $143.00. I went to the web, found a discount website which was charging $85.40. I then went right to the Hotel Website and found I could get a non-refundable rate of $72.52. The later is what I did, since I had trip insurance for my entire stay in Spain anyway. My ONLY complaint is that I emailed the hotel ahead of time to ask for a down pillow. (Their chain, Santos Hotels, advertises they have many choices of pillows, including down.) However, when I arrived, there were no down pillows. I showed the manager their advertising, which clearly shows they have such pillows. However, the Manager was not at all accommodating. Other than that, everything was great. The breakfast is expensive because they include wine and champagne. So if you don't plan to drink it, you can walk 1/4 mile to Burger King! This hotel was very clean and easily within walking distance of the Prado, Retiro Park and La Reina Sofia which contains Picasso's Guernica. I woulddefinitely stay here again.....but with my OWN pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location & great value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: NinsSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in the middle of summer for 4 nights, overall we were happy with the hotel. Things we liked: - Location - very close to all major museums and Madrid major park. Also well connected by metro to the rest of the city. The immediate area around the hotel doesn’t offer much (very few shops, cafes or restaurants) but the close proximity to the city helps. - Service – rooms are clean and very comfortable. Nice beds. Bathrooms are big and clean. Hotel staff are friendly. - Good value for money. Things we did not like: - Internet in the foyer too expensive and slow. - No safes in the rooms. Our stay was pleasant and comfortable, would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms but with area for improvements in hotel service”
Reviews.Author: hmtan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located around 10-15 mins (walk) away from Atocha train station. Thus, convenient for travelers who are getting around Spain by train. It is also easy to take the metro and explore Madrid. Hotel rooms are clean and comfortable for a good sleep at night. Internet connection is not free and is quite costly for the charges per hour. Do note that the use of the safe box in the hotel room is not free. Keys will need to be obtained from the reception and a deposit as well as a daily rental fee will be incurred.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cklonowski
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for one night because we wanted to be close to the Atocha railway station for our trip to Pamplona the next day. The hotel is located directly across from the cercanias part of Atocha, which is the suburban train platforms, and you can enter the station from the hotel by walking to the Atocha Renfe metro station about two blocks away and taking the underground pedestrian walkway. The Metro in Madrid is excellent and the trip to the city center, Puerta del Sol, is only 3 or 4 stops. In addition, the Reina Sofia, Prado, and Thyssen museums are all within a 10 minute walk. If I had to stay longer, I would have no doubt that our stay at the Hotel Agumar would have been just as pleasant as our single day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mbs1203
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights - cleaned, comfortable beds, great room service and hotel desk was friendly. Breakfast buffet - good however they need to make sure that once tortilla or fruit finishes that is it replaced immediately there was a delay in putting out more food. If you need a car service to take you to this hotel DO NOT USE AGILITY CAR SERVICE they left us stranded at the airport. Our flight was delayed, I told the driver holding my name to wait that we were collecting our baggage. I wait back 10 to 15 min later and found that he had left. They did not bother to get us another driver and they did not want to refund our money.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: yyz001ca
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are going to Madrid for a few days of museum tours and such. It is very conveniently located near the train station and is close by many of the wonderful museums Madrid has to offer. The hotel itself is very clean...the staff is extremely helpful (Monika at the front desk even went so far as to circle items of interest on a map for us and gave excellent directions to wherever we needed to go!)...exactly what we needed for our time there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: saeedkh5
Reviews.Content: Everything was right with the hotel, staff were helpful, you could walk to many central stations in 20-30 minutes, close to metro station. The breakfast was very expensive that we didn't mind

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbmvr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around 10 min walk from a major train/metro station Atocha Renfe. There are other hotels a bit closer to the station, though. It is a decent if somewhat old fashioned hotel, clean and presentable. Room was clean, service good. Two complaints, however: heaters in the bathroom are disconnected everywhere in the hotel, and because of the marble floors and walls, the bathrooms do need a working heater. The staff advised that the heaters in the bathrooms do not work. And that's that. The second complaint is that unlike some other hotels, the use of Internet is not free and is significantly more expensive than the Internet shops one can find not too far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and ticks all the boxes for me for a great stay in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninaandnigel
Reviews.Content: Convenient for the Atocha train station (day trip to Toledo recommended) and also to the main streets of Madrid and art galleries. Hotel met all our needs - quiet room requested at reception and was a reasonable size. Spotlessly clean room, beds and bathroom. Lovely big bath and powerful shower with lashings of hot water. Radio and TV easy to operate. Supermarket just down the road to left of hotel buy water etc. Only downside, no wifi. Would recommend this hotel as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Prado”
Reviews.Author: oatti0252
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Best Western Atlantico on Gran Via the Agumar Hotel was in a much quieter residential neighborhood. Very close to the Prado and the Reina Sofia Museums and the Atoche Rail Station...5 min. walk. The Hotel seemed like a "tour group" hotel....It was very clean, but stark and cold. You had to pay for the use of the internet and also to use the safe. The beer and wine were very expensive....better to go down the street to a local pub. There was a restaurant there but again...expensive. We only stayed here because my son is living in Madrid and it was close to his apt. Though we liked it for its proximity to the museums and the train. The staff were helpful...they had limited English.

Reviews.Title: “Medium priced hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Edrsa
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, reasonably sized room (twin occupancy). Close to Madrid's Atocha station. No street noise even though room overlooked main road. relatively easily accessible from Menendez Playo metro station. Receptionist wasn't the most friendly but this seems to be a Spanish thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, would use again!”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated 10-15 minutes walk from the Atocha Renfe station. The reception were friendly when I checked-in. I requested a high-up room which did not face the busy street and they honoured my request. I had a nice clean quiet twin non-smoking room. I have read other peoples reviews which were quite negative so perhaps I was lucky with my room! It was spacious. There was a luggage rack to hold a suitcase plus an additional pull-out table for additional luggage. There was also cupboard space with hangers for clothes. The marble bathroom had a bath, bidet and great power shower! It was spacious. It was a nice hotel and I paid £65 for a night through Expedia. I think it might be possible to get a room for less than I did since I happened to see a "do not disclose" note at reception on check-in with a room at 55 Euros. Also there were internet machines at the hotel which cost 3 Euros for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lizg48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. The room was better than expected, cozy and very comfortable. Bathroom was excellent. Very convenient to metro and art museums. Only drawback is lack of restaurants in immediate vicinity. We didn't try the in-house restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: coolercb
Reviews.Content: We have absolutely NO idea how this hotel was rated as a Four Star Hotel. We were completely taken off guard by the rude service we received at the front desk when we checked in, but stayed positive considering we just wanted to get upstairs and relax. Our next big surprise was served up once we walked into the hotel room: the rooms are absolutely tiny, maneuvering around it became a chore. Unfortunately it doesn't end here, the walls are paper thin considering we could hear the man in the room next to us do his business in the bathroom loud and clear the first two mornings. Also because the hotel is so old the entire room begins to take on a horrible smell if even one of the drains don't have the rubber cover properly put on. I would absolutely not recommend staying here, and was so happy that we didn't begin our trip at this hotel, and we certainly didn't spend the last 4 days of our trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but quite a walk from the tourist centre”
Reviews.Author: Jules1962
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 5 nights at this hotel. The hotel itself is ok, nothing special, but no specific complaints. The reception staff were not overly friendly on arrival but this may due to them having confused the name of the booking. Once this was resolved things improved. We had two rooms 319, 320 on the third floor - both have single beds only when we had ordered a double and the beds are on wheels which make them very mobile!! The bathroom was ok, a little tired but there was a plentiful supply of hot water and fresh towels. There is a tv in the room, a chair, desk and minibar. There is a safe located in the wardrobe but to use it you have to get a key from reception for which there is a daily charge - which is a bit stingy. We didn't eat in the hotel as we spent much of our time in the city, only returning to sleep and get changed for the evenings. The hotel is quite good value for money and provided you don't mind a good 15 minute walk on a very busy 6 lane lane road into the city there shouldn't be a problem. There are a couple of local shops which you can get drinks and that is by far much cheaper than using the minibar, and we had breakfast at a really friendly little cafe down the road near the Atocha Renfe metro station for breakfast each morning. The air conditioning was good and kept the rooms cool during the hot afternoons and evenings. I found it a little noisy at night so found myself turning it off. Overall I think the hotel was good, it was very clean and tidy and the local area seemed to be safe enough. The housekeeping staff were polite and friendly as was the doorman who was attentive and helpful with getting taxis for us.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good price ...”
Reviews.Author: drew610
Reviews.Content: At less than $100 USD a night, this was a good deal. The hotel is in a good location, right near the Prado, Reina Sofia, etc. A little away from all the craziness of the Puerta Del Sol and Plaza Mayor, but not too far away either. The bathroom is nice, and we had a nice little balcony, and the TV worked, but other than that, it was kind of drab hotel. We had reserved a king bed, checked in at noon, but on seeing two small twin beds in our room, we complained. The gentleman at the desk curtly denied our request. Oh well. If you can get a cheap rate and aren't going to Madrid for the hotel, this is a fine place to stay. RIght near the train station, which is good too.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and conventiently located hotel easily accessible from the metro stop”
Reviews.Author: Pambela
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the internet because of its proximatey to the Atoche Rail Station, as we were traveling on the fast train to Seville from that station. The hotel was very clean and the room was comfortable. For a large city we thought the cost was reasonable - ~$85.00 for a room with two twins. The bathroom was also very nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. If you wish to save money, the hotel can be reached from the airport by taking the metro to the Atoche Renfe Station (You change lines twice) It is then about a 5-10 minute walk from the metro stop/train station. The cost from the airport is 2 euro per person on the metro. It is also within walking distance of the Prado and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: SomersetKeithers
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy rooms, no coffee making facilities though, that were excellent value for the price we paid, get a outside facing room as some of the internal are only thin studded walled, noisey. Breakfast good variety and plentiful.Drinks and food a bit dearer than the norm, if you fancy a night cap there is a bar 150 meters up the road. Location close to the excellent Parque del Retiro, a must for a sunday stroll, only a 10 minute walk. Metro station a 5 minute walk, if staying for a couple of days suggest a 7.50 euro ticket as it gives you 10 journeys BUT BEWARE of pickpockets on the metro one of our party lost his camera and another had a hand in his pocket while sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Rather gloomy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Briquenay
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the excellent Las Cortes, moving to the Agumar was rather depressing. There's nothing really wrong about it, although the lobby smelled of stale food. The room was OK, although there are no doubles, and the soundproofing not perfect. The hotel is away from the centre, 10/15 minutes walk along a busy road. It's the kind of place you would end up in as part of a coach tour. If you have a choice, look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: weekender91
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated in a great spot to see Madrid. 10 - 15 mins away from the park and 20 mins away from shopping. The hotel was very clean and the staff hotel were very helpful. Buses and the metro just 2mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandyGnomad
Reviews.Content: Yes the lobby was nice and the food was alright the rooms on the other hand could use a makeover. I did not spend any time in other hotels in Madrid but in all the hotels we visited they were all in the same star rating but I would say this place definetly needs to update the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Good honest accomodation”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel staff were without exception superb. The service was second to none here and 24hr if you felt inclined. The hotel was fairly comfortable though, as often with city hotels I found the room a bit small. Sheets and towels changed, beds made daily, clean bathroom and shower basically everything you'd expect but with an extra smile. Food pretty mediocre but I didn't go to eat at the Hotel anyway. They don't even let you carry your bags about, we nearly had a fight to keep hold of them it was so efficient, basically don't try I guess they are serious about their jobs here. Waiters too, don't try to carry your food or drink upstairs they seem to be offended if you even try (and they didn't charge and they wouldn't take a tip!) Its fairly central when it comes to walking about town. Don't expect a stunning view out your window either this is city accomodation on a street, not a chateaux in the country. About 14 euros to the airport by Taxi oh and the doorman will hail you a cab in about 10 seconds if you're lucky, so be ready to leave. Not much else to say really. For me it was good value for money and a comfortable stressfree stay. What more could you ask for? Nice one Agumar you were brill!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Agumar - Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lbcman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Agumar in Madrid Spain has an amazing lobby/restaruants, very fancy. The rooms however are another story. They are clean, but very outdated, the best part were the bathrooms. I didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurants, but after looking at the prices I am glad I didn't. Will cost you about Euro30 to take a cab from the aeropuerto, not sure about the metro though, probably only a few euros, and it is about a 10 minutes walk from the main station to the hotel. Close relation to the downtown tourist traps...about a 15-20 minute walk passed beautiful old buildings, and the Retiro park. Hotel is rated as 4-Star, frankly I don't see it, but for $100 (canadian) per night I suppose it's not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room, nice location”
Reviews.Author: FromFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. The hotel is located a 7-minute walk away from the Atocha RENFE station. I arrived at 11:30pm and there were a few homeless people camping on the street leading to the hotel, but I didn't feel unsafe. The hotel claimed to be 4 stars, but the room I got was 2 stars at most. Tiny, worn, with a stinky aircondition unit that needed a desinfection. The aircondition only works when you are in the room and insert the keycard into the slot. My window went into the "inner courtyard" which was more like a small pit, dark even during the day. The mattress was good. There was a nice roomy marble bathroom though. The shower pressure was good. The breakfast buffet was OK, with several hot items and a nice cold selection. However, nearly all vacant tables in the breakfast room were full of dirty dishes from people who had breakfast before, the staff were not on a hurry to clear them. Not nice at all. There was a WiFi connection in the rooms and two internet PCs in the lobby, both available for a fee. Next time I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nazrool
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Agumar in August 2008 for 6 days. We are from Trinidad in the Caribbean. The Agumar is at least 3.5 stars and well worth it. The location is 8 minutes from downtown Madrid by bus. Atocha train station and atocha renfe metro stop are walking distance away. Retiro park, Reina Sofia and Prado are all closeby. Breakfast was really good. Rooms are clean and tidy. You should ask for a twin bed though if that's what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic. Nothing special, nothing bad.”
Reviews.Author: NC1313
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was average in every way. It was close to the train station as well as an underground, but that was about it for it's high points. We were willing to deal with because we got a decent price ($100/night). The staff was pretty rude and completely offended if you asked if someone spoke English. (To be fair, this was the whole of Madrid - luckily we do speak decent Spanish). The beds were small, the linens were itchy and the maids never came into our room. We stayed there for 3 nights and we made our own beds each night - even after we told the front desk. I will say that I never heard any noise from the street and I had a room that faced the 4 lane traffic. The energy conservation was also commendable. You had to have your door key in the room energy slot for any of the electricity in the room to work, so when you left you wouldn't leave lights on. If you have the money to stay elsewhere I'd suggest you do that instead, but if you're on a budget and don't intend to do much other than sleep, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: suziegg
Reviews.Content: This was a disgrace! In fact, although we had paid in advance for 3 nights, we moved out and found a new hotel the same afternoon we booked in! No double beds; unhelpful staff. This is a hotel to avoid!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on the street (very noisy)”
Reviews.Author: ekant
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Paseo de la Reina Cristina, a very noisy major street with 4 lanes of cars on one side and 3 on the other, there is traffic day and night. I got a room on the street and I could not sleep, because the window does not stop the noise. I asked a room on the back, on a high floor, and then it was OK (no noise from outside). One can hear some noise from neighbor rooms but this is very acceptable. This is a big impersonal hotel, perhaps more a 3 stars and a 4 star. The size of the double room was large enough. The internet was free. One has to walk to go to nicer areas, e.g. to have the choice for restaurant, the area is not specially nice. The location is interesting if you need to take the train at Atocha (e.g. if you work in some suburb which was my case).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Avoid the Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: joninnerja
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Madrid on the new AVE (High Speed Train) link (excellent) from Málaga and spent one night at this hotel, 6/7 minutes walk from the terminal. Our booking was through an agency, saving a considerable % on the hotel 'rack rate', and not surprisingly perhaps we were allocated a room on the first floor facing the main street, along which traffic never ceases, so noise was an issue. On close examination it quickly becomes obvious that the four stars that the hotel claims must be well past their sell by date! No tea or coffee making facilities in the room, some facilities didn't work, the staff were not particularly friendly or helpful and there was a general feeling of tiredness about the whole place. The worst experience of our short stay was the restaurant however. Originally we had decided to eat in the cafeteria, not wanting a full-blown meal, but at 7.45 were told that the kitchen serving the cafe was about to close, strangely enough co-inciding with the opening up of the much more expensive restaurant. Throughout the hotel the cafeteria is posted as closing at 23.30 so it wouldn't be unreasonable perhaps to expect that food would be available until maybe an hour or so before close, but apparently this was not the case. The weather outside was anything but pleasant so we opted for the restaurant instead. Bad move, and the fact we were the only two guests dining in there that night should have been a warning. Those 'in the know' don't go there. The mixed grill (x2, at €18 pp + 7% iva) was barely luke warm, the majority of the items were either tough, full of gristle and fat or just completely tasteless, and I sent my meal back to the kitchen virtually untouched. I have worked in the catering industry in a number of kitchen environments and can honestly say that if I had ever sent such a meal to a table I would not expect to be employed by the end of the night. What made things worse was that upon coming out of the restaurant there were people enjoying food in the cafeteria area, so we had been deliberately misled (some might say lied to) by the staff - and it cannot be put down to a language problem as we both live and work in Spain, and are pretty fluent with the language. I complained at some length but was met with an attitude even less satisfying than the meal - and on checking out in the morning the full meal price was on the bill. If you are going to stay at this hotel, which does enjoy a good location if you don't want city centre, don't expect 4 star standards and (IMO) don't go near the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic stay in a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Quazzie2002
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to state that I came here as part of a group of guys on my stag(bachelor) weekend. After reading some of the earlier reviews about how this was a 3 star hotel posing as a 4 star I was initially worried but decided to book anyways because I wasn't planning on spending too much time in the hotel. Boy was i wrong. whoever wrote them earlier reviews needs to recheck a few things. Upon arrival at the front door we were greeted by two lovely polite and well dressed doormen who took our bags straight to our room. check in was a breeze which was great considering my spanish was limited to some phrases from cowboy movies. We were put in 4 rooms at the end of a hallway where we felt we had the run of the place, the room had a safe (deposit for the key) a well stocked and reasonably priced mini bar, tv with lots of channels(some english & german) and two beds in a well spaced out room. Much more than the hostel I was expecting after reading some reviews. The hotel is located about 10 minutes from Atocha Renfe station which is one of the major stations and the one we used as our base for transport to the rest of the city. and the metro for €1 pre ride couldn't be cheaper, although the taxi fares were hardly bank breaking either. I've seen this hotel advertised for €150 a night which I thought was reasonable but I was even more pleased considering I got a rate of €65 per room per night. which personally I think is a steal. The hotel bar is pleasant if maybe a bit quiet but overall I cannot fault this. P.s The adjoining Salsa dance club is highly recommended. P.P.S Peter the Concierge is one of the most helpful men I have ever met, please tip well.. A trully lovely guy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and nice accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: alykaye
Reviews.Content: Great location, a few blocks from Atocha train station and connections to Sevilla, Cordoba, etc. Booked into Agumar as part of tour group in high season, but hotel was never overrun with tourists. Fantastic breakfast and staff--most speak/understand English. Only time there was trouble with language was at breakfast in stating room number. My mother resorted to miming the numbers. There is an all-purpose convenience store just down the street. Turning left out of the front door, the store is about half a block--look for the bright blue doors!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location! otherwise not interesting”
Reviews.Author: SandB
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to posh shopping region of Madrid in a lux residential area - far outside the touristy cheap areas like Sol& Gran Via. Retiro park is a good 10-15min walk as well but still close. There were very nice tapa bars and restaurants in Salamance again within 10 min walk. We had a good last minute deal so I think it worked well for us for 1 night over a weekend. On the other hand, rooms were clean and had all sorts of amenities although a bit old. If the hotel were to renovated, it would be my favorite, until then it is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: LondonA_s
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't class this hotel as a 4 star. Nice lobby but rooms are very basic and a bit dated. Location is good, it's a 5 minutes walk from Atoche Renfe metro station and 6/7 minutes from Atoche. You cal walk to Retiro Park in 10 mins. Reception staff are painfully slow at dealing with enquires, and check in. Check in took 30 mins!!!! I have stayed at the 4 star Carlton Hotel in Madrid and the hotel is much better. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: midmag286
Reviews.Content: unlike some reviews we found the hotel very comfortable spotless and not noisy. staff were very helpful and friendly, for the price we paid it was well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: graham247
Reviews.Content: The hotel is past its prime and would struggle to claim 4*. But it is good value and quite a short walk to the golden triangle of Attractions. Atocha station is close at hand. Don't expert to much by way of customer service beyond the perfunctionary. The walls are incredably thin so expect to sleep and wake at the same time as your neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Headjoint
Reviews.Content: The plus points about this hotel are that it is close to Atocha station, a short walk from the museums and that the area is OK at night. La Basílica de Nuestra Señora de Atocha is just 100 metres away across the street. The staff were polite and helpful, the room was clean and the air-con worked OK. For less than 70 euros a night for a twin room I have no complaints at all. However, its windows offer better sound proofing than the walls, so if you are a light sleeper and have newlyweds in the next room...... Remember to visit the botanic gardens. The best way to spend 2 euros in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 STARS!”
Reviews.Author: nvg
Reviews.Content: I absolutely agree w the complaints others had. my room 4 stars? no. I could barely walk around the bed. terrible view of the back staircase of an apt bldg. 2 good things: bartender gave me a glass of ice to take to my room convenient to metro and one side of park

Reviews.Title: “Lousy front desk”
Reviews.Author: malachOR59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is accessible by bus (nos. 10,14,C1) and if one is willing to walk three blocks downhill (uphill upon returning) via metro. Taxi from Atocha train station is only 6 euros. Hotel facilities are worth its price. Towels are not that clean (even if fresh every morning). The real downside are the very unfriendly front desk staff who are totally unhelpful and irritable. I have toured four continents...but this hotel´s staff beats them all in being rude and unfriendly. I will never ever go back to this hotel again...despite its discount price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyandme
