Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of this hotel before leaving for a tour of Spain & Portugal, and was aware of the comments. After staying there for 2 nights with the tour group, I have to agree with those who do not rate this hotel a 3 or 4. The walls were more than paper thin, in fact I could have included myself in a conversation with my next door neighbor if I spoke French. The bed was not comfortable, and our windows faced a building that looked like it should have been vacant, but probably not. Our friends had at least 4 moths flying around in their room, and we had odors in ours, due to the fact that we were probably over the kitchen somewhere. The location was a few blocks from the train station which I suppose is good for those from the continent, but consider the location. We had to take a bus just to get to the Puerta del sole area, and everywhere else we went. Forget finding a place to eat, including a small restaurant or take out. We walked two blocks each way, and there wasn't a decent place. We finally came back to the hotel and ordered a club sandwich. I will say that this was good. However, around 20 of us ate dinner in the dining room that last evening, and believe me it was absolutely terrible. It must have cost my husband and I around $100 for 2 dinners and a bottle of wine. The paella was awful, and my sea bass which was supposed to be filleted, still had very large bones in it, and the meal was cold. Not luke warm, but cold. A few of us had to send our meals back just to get them warm. No, not my choice or recommendation of a hotel, and my husband and I just returned from 6 weeks in southern Europe. I will recommend the Tryp Cibeles hotel on Grand Via for E101 including breakfast. Now this is a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan94
Reviews.Content: Great value. Close to Atocha Train Station. Easy to walk to Metro and connect to Airport. Used as a base (Checked in and out several times over a week period), they stored excess luggage. Assisted with lost baggage issue. Cost of public internet is on the high side. Breakfast buffet is very good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: sphinx159
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in, the experience was bad. The people behind the desk were unfriendly, almost rude, and not just to us. Our room seemed okay, even nice, until we discovered a burnt out lightbulb, pages missing from that "welcome" book thingy, hairs in the shower, and, finally, some dark 'n' curlies in the bed. Yuck. Room service was slow & tasteless, and the guy who delivered it sneezed on our food and admitted he had a bad cold. Again, yuck. The worst experience was when i had to go to the hospital, obviously very ill. I asked the woman at the front desk for directions to the nearest one. I kid you not, she rolled her eyes, pulled out a map, circled something, slid the map at me, and continued gossiping w/ her co-worker. Not even an offer to help me get a taxi. Not the best customer service to get when you have a high fever. And the icing on the cake was when they handed me my final bill on check out, they'd added a zero to it (3500 euros for 3 nights!). However, to its credit, the location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: paulchamberlain
Reviews.Content: Good standard & good value of hotel in excellent position for access to Metro system & Prado Room average hotel size with all ameneties expected of a 4* hotel Noise insulation could be improved though did not cauuse a problem with us for sleeping Bar prices good Breakfast expensive & very average in comparison to availability in town.

Reviews.Title: “Was Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No complaints here 21 euros from airport to door, quality twin bedroom, saw inside a double looked small, great shower, bathtub, had breakfast 12 euros as much as you want buffet, hot, cold, wine, coffee fruit bacon list is endless. hotel staff slow to give you attention (so the moaning yanks wont like that,) but hey relax its a holiday, spot on service when they do attend to you. metro atocha renfe 5 minute walk when you turn right out of hotel, 3 stops, blue line, takes you to SOL , the main area, (take a look at the tropical garden at atocha station amazing.) if you want comfort go for it madrids ace, just too many moaning yanks who think they are a superior race to everyone else

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TD726
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I am a college student, however, I have travelled quite extensively as I was an exchange student in Europe. One of my friends was studying in Madrid, so two of my friends and I decided to visit her over Thanksgiving. The hotel was given a 4-star rating, however it was nowhere close to that. The location wasn't great, not near any attractions and about a 10 minute walk to the subway. The "two queen size beds" turned out to be two twins and there was no room to put in a cot, so two of us squeezed into a twin together (good thing we have been friends since elementry school!). As I was first to arrive, I found the hotel staff to be rude and unaccomadating. I am Spanish major and have studied in Barcelona and never have I found the Spaniards to be rude, however I was appalled by the way that I was treated. There were two people behind the desk and it took them five minutes to even begin helping me even though I was the only person waiting. They then acted as if they could not understand my Spanish (I never had anyone else in Madrid NOT understand what I was saying) and when I decided just to convert to English, I found that they did not speak English. There were no bellman to bring my bags to my room (4 star?). Lastly, the noise. The people in the room next to us stayed up most of the night (honeymooners, we guessed) and it was difficult to sleep as the walls are PAPERTHIN. Also, there is a disco located next to the hotel, and you can hear the music and the people coming and going at all hours. I feel that it was overpriced at $70 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Makes me laugh all these people complainig about how noisy or how thin are the walls or if it is a motel 78 in Wonderfull USA, at least is more difficult or almost impossible to get a gun and kill someone nearby like in USA and we felt very safe (i couldn't say the same about Usa or London). The hotel was fantastic, the staff very efficient and friendly and the hotel is close to atocha station, El Prado and Reina Sofia Musseum. We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel, it cost 12 euros and was good. I also want to recommend a musical called "Hoy no me puedo levantar" by a Spanish band called Mecano than we did really enjoy. Viva Mecano

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: Silviaveces
Reviews.Content: The only good about this hotel is the location; rooms are extremely noisy, not only because of the traffic outside but because you can hear the people next door´s as if they were in your room. The reception staff is anything but rude and as cold as ice. We asked for a double bed but were given twin beds and when we let them know they kind of laughed at us. Really horrible stay. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Carpet_Ride
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agumar on a short trip to Madrid in Dec 2005. We got a good deal on the hotel and were looking forward to an enjoyable stay. Unfortunately, we were disappointed by the hotel. The decor is pretty old and in need of updating. The rooms are pretty basic and were very dusty. The bath had a weird design resulting in the floor getting wet whenever the shower was used. The room has a safe but there is a deposit and daily charge for using it. The reception had only one person fluent in English and was not tourist friendly or able to answer questions about Madrid. However, they did manage to get us great seats for a Real Madrid match. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from a Metro station and near Atocha station.However, it is not very well located for exploring Madrid. All in all, an average hotel. You should be able to get better hotels that are more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is equivilant to 2-3 star hotel. Both inside and outside rooms are very noisy with traffic, paper thin walls and noisy water pipes all night. The air conditioning didn't work and when I inquired about it was told "it's now winter we shut it off". The maids are very good but the desk people are JUST DOING THEIR JOB. The lighting in the rooms is bad, a woman chosing to use make-up has a major problem. I think you get the drift of my comments, this hotel just does not measure up........Thanks..Jack

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband,from 12th september to 15th. I had read reviews before that this hotel was not central,well we di not feel that was a problem,as it was 3 or stops on metro to the centre(like times square or oxford street) the walk to the metro was less than 5 mins and the walk to the centre was about 20 min, so not that far but for us is was good to come out of the noisy centre. Hotel was clean,porters very keen to have your bags before you got out the car. staff at desk were polite but not overly helpful. The room was clean, we ahd verything we needed,lift was fast, We had breakfast in the hotel first morning,you pay extra for that,it was something likr 13 euros but it was worth it because you could have as much as you wanted and their was a very big selection. Although good for my husband who has more of an appetite than me, I do not eat much in morning so we tried local cafes in sol whcih offered breakfast foir half that and were equally nice. Madrid was lovely,safe at night, restaurants had a good service. Hotel good location, in agood suburb as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, But Location was Average!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and are a decent size. I really liked this hotel but the location is a little far off. It is a close walk to the metro where you can access the entire city, but it is not in the city center. As a tourist that was only visiting the city for a few days, I think it would have been more beneficial to have been in the middle of city with more lively entertainment nearby. I also found the staff to be some-what helpful but not the nicest staff in the world. For a four star hotel you get what you exact (my european standards) and the price reflects that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Atocha train station. It was perfect for a quick stay in Madrid where I needed to get the train stations 4 times in 3 days. The buses outside run near Sol and it was near the El Retiro park. Walking around was easy and it is about a 5 minute walk to some musuems and restaurants .. there is not much near the hotel but it is only a few minute walk to more action. The hotel staff was very helpful and the hotel was very nice and clean. I booked using bancotel and paid 50 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayJayM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week and it couldn't have been better, it was ideally located for the metro. The hotel was lovely and clean, our room was cleaned every single day but we were never disturbed by cleaners when we slept until the afternoon. It was quiet, had everything we needed and we had no complaints at all. The staff were efficient, the restaurant, which we ate in once and it was quite late at night served us with a lovely meal and excellent wine. I think the people who may not have enjoyed this hotel are probably used to the 'holiday beach resort' type hotel and need to remember this is a city centre hotel more set up for business trippers than the 'benidorm crews'.

HotelInfo.Name: Agumar Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo Reina Cristina 7, 28014 Madrid, Spain
